events.name: Data In Power - NYC Event
events.description: â€‹Data and the distribution of decision-making power is an increasingly important dynamic to understand and engage with in climate and energy. Who is collecting, analyzing, and presenting data - how and why? These are the hard-hitting questions we will unpack in an open format discussion. If you have been looking for a space to share and engage with multiple perspectives through concrete examples of dataâ€™s influence within climate and energy decision-making, this event is for you!â€‹*Note: This is a small group discussion so that we can dive deep into Data In Power principles and examples while building relationships. If you are interested, please RSVP even if the event is full, so that I can plan more for the calendar.â€‹Data In Power is an independently run meetup without any bells and whistles. To maintain our community and sustain organic growth, please support our venue with a refreshment purchase and join the group to share perspectives on the dynamic between data and decision-making.

events.name: 104th NY Hardware Meetup // Climate Tech & Supply Chain
events.description: â€‹â€‹â€‹The Hardware Meetup community is excited to announce the 104th NY Hardware Meetup at frogâ€‹â€‹â€‹Hardware Meetups happen across 30+ cities around the world, bringing together hardware professionals to network and learn from each other. You might not realize it, but NYC is a hotbed for this kind of innovation and tonight you'll meet two companies working at the cutting edge of this technology.â€‹â€‹â€‹This month we'll be atfrog.frogis a leading global creative consultancy, part of Capgemini Invent. We partner with passionate leaders and visionary entrepreneurs, to imagine and build experiences, products and businesses across physical and digital that disrupt the status quo, win hearts and realize the future.â€‹â€‹â€‹SPEAKERSâ€‹Nathan is Cofounder & CEO ofit's electric, an EV charging network with a mission to expand public charging in cities. Serving the 70 million US drivers who live in apartments, it's electric has developed a charger purpose-builtÂ for sidewalks and cityÂ streets. Featuring a sleek, durable (vandal resistant) design, it's electric's chargers are the first in North America to feature a detachable charging cable. With chargers already active in NYC and Detroit, and with new deployments coming to Boston, Los Angeles, and several other cities in 2025, it's electric is moving quickly to ensure all drivers have access to convenient and reliable EV charging.â€‹TBDâ€‹TBDâ€‹â€‹AGENDAâ€‹â€‹â€‹6:30 - Arrival, mingle, grab refreshmentsâ€‹â€‹â€‹7:00 - Welcome and introductionâ€‹7:15- Guest speakers with audience Q+Aâ€‹8:20 - Community open micâ€‹â€‹â€‹Anyone will have the chance or talk about what they are working on.â€‹8:30 - Mix + mingleâ€‹THANK YOU TO OUR SPONSORSâ€‹Genimexis a global manufacturer with over 50 years of experience producing high-quality consumer products. We work with startups, growing brands, and design agencies, solving technical problems, driving innovation, and bringing products from concept to manufacturing. With in-house expertise in DFM, engineering, quality control, and supply chain, we ensure seamless execution at every stage. Our extensive manufacturing footprint across China and Southeast Asia provides flexibility, cost efficiency, diversification, and scalability.â€‹â€‹frogis a leading global creative consultancy, part of Capgemini Invent. We partner with passionate leaders and visionary entrepreneurs, to imagine and build experiences, products and businesses across physical and digital that disrupt the status quo, win hearts and realize the future. In addition, we offer industrial design, product architecture, and product development services, as well as partner with Synapse onÂ hardwareÂ engineering. To book a free 30 minute consultation or feedback session, please sign up for atimeslot here. ApplicationsÂ to frogTank can be foundhere.â€‹THANK YOU TO OUR PARTNERSâ€‹â€‹â€‹informalis a freelance collective for the most talented independent professionals in hardware and hardtech. With expertise in a diverse range of industries from consumer electronics to automotive, climate tech to medical devices, informal members work with clients at every stage to design, manufacture, and scale top-quality physical products. Whether you're looking for a single contractor, a full-time employee, or an entire team of professionals to work on everything from product development to go-to-market strategy, the informal collective has the perfect collection of people for the job.Learn more.â€‹â€‹WANT TO GET INVOLVED?â€‹â€‹Sponsorship:â€‹We offer exclusive access to our 10,000+ member community through sponsorships.â€‹â€‹Host an event at your space:We are always looking for host sponsors to provide access to unique spaces from cool hardware companies building interesting things. Want to open up your office?â€‹â€‹Speaker:Do you have something interesting to share with our community? We're on the lookout for fresh faces to talk about their journey and experiences.â€‹â€‹If you want to get involved, head here:https://linktr.ee/nyhardware

events.name: GenZtea x Boss Me In: Gen Z Founder Match at Chief
events.description: â€‹Join a handpicked cohort of visionary Gen Z female founders for an intimate evening with members of Chief - the most exclusive private network for women executives at the VP and C-suite level, whose members lead organizations valued at over $800 billion collectively.â€‹About the Event:â€‹In Chief's prestigious Manhattan clubhouse, where membership is by invitation-only and has a waitlist of thousands, 20 carefully selected Gen Z female founders will have the opportunity to connect one-on-one with some of business's most influential women leaders. This meticulously curated evening brings together today's Fortune 500 executives with tomorrow's groundbreaking entrepreneurs.â€‹Who Will Be There:â€‹- 20 Selected Gen Z Female Foundersâ€‹- 20 Chief Members (Women executives from Director to C-suite level at Fortune 500 companies, fastest-growing startups, and globally recognized brands)â€‹About the Hosts:â€‹Chief is the most coveted private membership network for senior women executives, with an acceptance rate lower than Harvard. Members include executives from companies like Google, Nike, Goldman Sachs, and other industry-defining organizations. Chief's highly vetted community represents the upper echelon of business leadership, with membership limited to executives at the highest levels of organizational influence.â€‹Boss Me In is pioneering the future of intergenerational leadership, bridging the expertise gap between seasoned executives and emerging leaders through carefully curated connections and transformative experiences.â€‹GenZtea, spanning 21 countries, represents the elite network of Gen Z founders, creators, and investors shaping tomorrow's business landscape. Their partnerships with prestigious institutions and luxury brands like Pace University and Kiehl's showcase their commitment to elevating the next generation of business leaders.â€‹This is a once-in-a-career opportunity to join an evening of unparalleled access and connection.â€‹[Apply Now - Limited to 20 Gen Z Founders]â€‹Location: Chief's Private Members' Club, NYCâ€‹Due to the highly exclusive nature of this event, applications will undergo a rigorous review process. Selected participants will represent the most promising ventures and innovative thinking in their respective industries.

events.name: aci-d trip : The Lubalin Archives
events.description: â€‹Join us for a visit to the Lubalin Archives at The Cooper Union.The Lubalin Center preserves the work of Herb Lubalin and other designers through an archive that includes drawings, type specimens, posters, logos, and advertising materials. Lubalin is a goated American Graphic Designer and this growing archive contain works not only by him but also Paul Rand, Milton Glaser, Massimo Vignelli, and many others.â€‹The archive isnâ€™t digitized so you literally wonâ€™t be able to find its stuff on are.na, Pinterest, google images etc. Weâ€™re moving beyond aesthetics and engaging with materiality and context, folks! As someone who has visited the archives, Iâ€™d say it contains some of the best design references in the country.â€‹Weâ€™re getting a hands-on presentation of a selection of material which lasts about an hour and a half. The presentation is different every time and tailored to the group, so even if youâ€™ve been to the archives before, itâ€™s unlikely that the presentation will be the same. It's a closer look at some of the objects in the collection, the stories behind them, and what they can teach us about making work today. The emphasis is on ways we can make active use of design history as contemporary practitioners. The curators will use physical examples from the collection to construct specific case studies of ways we can look at objects to inform today's design decisions.â€‹The Center usually doesnâ€™t host groups past 3 PM, but theyâ€™ve graciously agreed to keep the archive open for us until 6 PM on Friday, allowing for a 4 PM start. You may need to leave work a little early, but itâ€™s a Friday and well worth it.
